page.title: 12Bayford Footpath Walk 2.
page.content: Walked in June, it is 4.5 km long. It starts at G.R. 312083 and is part of{Herts. Byways & Bridleways Route 3. Going up a slight hill through woods, it is in very good condition & is 8ft wide. At Keepers Cottage it narrows but remains in generally good condition. To the right are woods and fields. The path continues to the road where a {blue sign '3-E'}indicates 'Bayford 1 mile.' At road junction (301079) the b'way continues. It is{very}muddy, boots are essential. The path gets clearer but by Bucks Farm it deteriorates rapidly, curving to the left. The path turns to shale for a short distance but gets slightly muddy uphill. The path{ends {on Bucks Alley,}which goes into Little Berkhamsted.
